de.htw.hundertwasser.core

Class Photo

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.htw.hundertwasser.core.Photo

  • public class Photo
extends java.lang.Object
    This class abstracts a Photo There should be only the path to the file to display it. The display itself is realized with another object to the Image Manager.
    Author:
    daniel rhein

      • manager

        private ImageManager manager
        This is an instance of the ImageManager he'll keeps up the loading of Images by their absolute Filepath.

      • pathToFile

        private java.lang.String pathToFile
        This is the Path to the file. It will reference where the Image is kept on the HDD.

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        This is the name of the Photo. It will be referenced by this variable.

      • m_image

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage m_image
        This is the Image of a Photo. Once if it is read form the HDD it will be kept in this variable.<\p> And it will only reread if the developer will reread it.

        This is the comment for the currrent photo.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                             java.io.IOException,
                                             InsufficientPrivilegesException
        Deliver the file from HDD. If it's already set it will return the content of bufferedImage.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file not exists
        java.io.IOException - if the file can't be written
        InsufficientPrivilegesException - if you have insufficient privilege for the file.
